text_highlighted: The program can"t decrypt content because MSVCR110.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem.

mitre_attack_techniques.signature_description: script started by non script file
Very long cmdline option found, this is very uncommon (may be encrypted or packed)
Document contains an embedded VBA macro which executes code when the document is opened / closed
Document contains an embedded VBA macro which may execute processes
Document contains an embedded VBA macro with suspicious strings
Potential document exploit detected (unknown TCP traffic)
Creates a process in suspended mode (likely to inject code)
Creates files inside the user directory
Office document tries to convince victim to disable security protection (e.g. to enable ActiveX or Macros)
May sleep (evasive loops) to hinder dynamic analysis
Queries a list of all running processes
Sample monitors Window changes (e.g. starting applications), analyze the sample with the simulation cookbook
Queries the volume information (name, serial number etc) of a device

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Binaries and Scripts in Public Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of a file with a suspicious extension in the public folder, which could indicate potential malicious activity.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Application File Write to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Windows shells and scripting applications that write files to suspicious folders

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Malicious Base64 Encoded PowerShell Keywords in Command Lines
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Execution of Powershell Script in Public Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: This rule detects execution of PowerShell scripts located in the "C:\Users\Public" folder

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects UTF-8 and UTF-16 Base64 encoded powershell 'Invoke-' calls
Detects usage of a base64 encoded "FromBase64String" cmdlet in a process command line

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential WMI Lateral Movement WmiPrvSE Spawned PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.

Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Recon Command Output Piped To Findstr.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the execution of a potential recon command where the results are piped to "findstr". This is meant to trigger on inline calls of "cmd.exe" via the "/c" or "/k" for example.
Attackers often time use this technique to extract specific information they require in their reconnaissance phase.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload
Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.
Detects PowerShell creating a PowerShell file (.ps1). While often times this behavior is benign, sometimes it can be a sign of a dropper script trying to achieve persistence.
Detects the use of PowerShell to identify the current logged user.

T1203.description: Potential document exploit detected (unknown TCP traffic)

Very long cmdline option found, this is very uncommon (may be encrypted or packed)
